Format columns

Source: vignettes/format_columns.Rmd
format_columns.Rmd

This vignette introduces how to format columns in flextable.

library(ftExtra)

Treat character columns as markdown columns

The example below shows that colformat_md() function parses markdown texts in flextable.

data.frame(
  x = c("**bold**", "*italic*"),
  y = c("^superscript^", "~subscript~"),
  z = c("***~ft~^Extra^** is*", "*Cool*"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
) %>%
  as_flextable() %>%
  colformat_md()

x

y

z

bold

superscript

ftExtra is

italic

subscript

Cool

Currently, bold, italic, superscript, and subscript are supported. Note that other syntax may result in unexpected behaviors.
